title: Business Live: FTSE closes lower - BBC News
summary: heathrow decision to await cabinet view .
uk economy faces prolonged weakness : item club .

documents.title: that 's all folks !
text: back tomorrow - with the latest on the markets and uk inflation figures .

documents.title: stranger things and narco help netflixjust in
text: the tv programmes stranger things and a second series of narcos have helped earnings at the online streaming site netflix .
it says quarterly global streaming revenue exceeded $ 2bn for the first time ( up 36 % year over year ) in the third quarter .
and it added 0.4 million members in the us verus its forecast of 0.3 million and 3.2 million members internationally vs. our forecast of 2.0 million .

`` as discussed , for the balance of 2016 , we will continue to operate around break even , and then start generating material global profits in 2017 and beyond , by marching up operating margins steadily for many years , '' the company added in its statement .
shares are up 18 % in after-hours trading .

documents.title: us markets close lower
text: a pretty subdued trading day in new york .
the dow jones closed 0.29 % down , to end at 18,086
the nasdaq ended down 0.27 % at 5,199
the s & p 500 finished 0.31 % lower , to close at 2,126

documents.title: what 's behind hammond mutterings ? laura kuenssberg , bbc political editor writes :
text: the prime minister has `` full confidence '' in the chancellor .

in days gone by , even the very fact that question was posed was the canary in the coalmine - when journalists knew a minister was in real trouble , proper trouble , it was time to ask that question .

if there was any hesitation , any delay , any raise of the eyebrow from the number 10 official cursed with taking that day 's lobby briefing , it was a sure sign that the unlucky cabinet member was on their way out .
read laura 's analysis here

text: good phone call with pm @ twitterid we agreed that pm may will update on brexit , art .
50 at this week 's # euco

it 's a bit shameful .

a 2yr deal deadline , or else we lose tariff-free access to 45 % of our trade while they lose < 10 % .

documents.title: `` tired of fog ? try the frogs ! ''
text: paris has launched a post-brexit campaign to try and lure city bankers across the water .
la defense is the financial district of paris and the billboard seen above has been posted at heathrow and on the eurostar .

`` as regrettable as britain 's exit from the european union may be , we have to be pragmatic and promote our own assets , '' patrick devedjian , head of the elected council representing the hauts-de-seine district where la defense is located , said in a statement .

documents.title: inflation to up ?
text: and more signs of rising prices are expected to come tomorrow .
monthly inflation figures for september are due out .
analysts are expecting prices to rise by an annual rate of 0.9 % , near a two-year high , up from 0.6 % in august .
that 's in part due to the weak pound .
kathleen brooks from city index explains how that works :
the pound falls sharply across a broad range of currencies
foreign import prices get more expensive
producers and retailers have to accept higher costs , which they eventually pass onto the consumer

documents.title: petrol price 'highest in a year '
text: the motoring group aa have published figures showing the average price of a litre of petrol has hit £ 1.15 - the most expensive it 's been since august last year .
in march the average price was £ 1.02 .

aa president edmund king said : `` this is a hammer blow not only to family and business finances but a severe shock when people consider that supermarket fuel was available at £ 1 a litre earlier this year . ''

documents.title: waste of money ? cnbc tweets :
text: `` the state pension system simply gave away tens or even hundreds of millions of dollars in fees every year for 10 years to hedge fund managers , and received no value in return , '' the new york state department of financial services said .
new york wasted $ 1 billion on hedge fund fees , watchdogs charge
cronyism
it 's called corruption
why is fusion not surprised ?
in my book which predicted it

documents.title: marseille football club bought by us businessman
text: frank mccourt , former owner of the baseball team los angeles dodgers , has bought the french football club olympic marseille .
he has promised fans that he would push the club to the `` highest ranks of european football '' , and that `` we have the resources and courage necessary to invest '' .
mr mccourt is the latest in a string of us businessmen buying up european football clubs .
manchester united , arsenal , liverpool and roma all have us owners .

documents.title: rbs and rt
text: this is interesting .
earlier today the london-based rt tv channel ( formerly russia today ) said that natwest had told it that its accounts would be closed by 12 december .
there would , apparently , be no discussion .
that line appears to have changed .
this evening the rbs group ( which owns natwest ) says : these decisions are not taken lightly .
we are reviewing the situation and are contacting the customer to discuss this further.the bank accounts remain open and are still operative . ''
well , that 's not quite telling someone to sling their hook , is it ?

documents.title: unfashionable fashion
text: fashion retail in the uk had seen its steepest fall in sales since 2009 , according to data from kantar worldpanel .
it says that the industry has seen four consecutive months of sales declines in the year to september , with £ 700m lost from the value of the market from this time last year .

`` fashion retailers are still following the same patterns of over-buying and deep discounting and consumers are increasingly reluctant to pay full price , '' said glen tooke , consumer insight director at kantar worldpanel .
`` most recently the decline has been driven by falling frequencies of buying , giving retailers fewer opportunities to encourage shoppers to part with their cash . ''

documents.title: pepsi promise
text: the drinks company pepsi has made another promise to cut the volume of sugary drinks it sells .
it has promised that by 2025 , at least two-thirds of the 12 ounce beverages it sells will contain 100 or fewer calories .
governments are clamping down on sugar - with the uk introducing a sugar tax and similar measures introduced in some us cities , mexico and hungary , according to bloomberg news .
the world health organization has also suggested that by driving retail prices up by 20 % , consumption will drop by a fifth .

documents.title: netflix results
text: after the close of the bell in the us , netflix reports results .
shares in the online tv company are trading lower ahead of the numbers , as analysts expect weak subscriber growth .
market analyst at city index , ken odeluga says : `` netflix 's us subscriber growth hit a giddy peak in the first quarter of this year at well above 4 million net additions .
`` it then slumped to a rate that was no more than half that in the next two quarters . ''
its costs have risen , he says , and competition has increased .

`` the question is whether 'binge-watching ' will rise fast enough to justify a netflix valuation that is 311 times its earnings over the last twelve months , and 136 times income forecast for fiscal 2016 . ''
for this quarter , he adds : `` at the very least , the group needs to hit guidance that it will add 300,000 us subscribers in its third quarter and 2 million overseas . ''

documents.title: us markets
text: i feel obliged to give you an update on the markets - but really not much has moved .
the dow jones has lost a bit more ground - currently down 0.18 % at 18,105
the s & p 500 is down 0.13 % at 2,130
and the tech-heavy nasdaq has barely moved at 5,211 .

documents.title: standard life scrutinises annuity sales
text: you may recall that last week the chief city regulator , the financial conduct authority ( fca ) , said that about 90,000 people should be compensated for being given a bad deal when they bought an annuity , sometime between 2008 and 2015 .
now standard life says it is one of the firms which is having to go back through its past annuity sales , to see who might be eligible for a payment .

`` at the request of the fca , standard life will conduct a review of all non-advised annuity sales from july 2008 to identify whether our customers received sufficient information about enhanced annuities to make the right decisions about their purchase , '' the life insurer says .
`` it is not yet possible to determine a reliable estimate of the quantum of any redress associated with this process . ''
at issue was the failure of insurers to tell customers in poor health that their conditions meant they could receive an `` enhanced '' annuity with higher payouts , or indeed shop around for one .

documents.title: with ftse near record highs why are companies scaling back or pulling ipos ?
text: this should be a fantastic time to sell shares .
after all the ftse 100 is hovering near record highs , so why has waste management company biffa been forced to offer a discount on the shares it is selling ?
it is not the only one to scale back its ambitions .
software firm misys has cut the amount it hopes to raise by £ 1bn , while several other companies have decided to shelve their plans to list on the stock market - at least for now .
meanwhile in the us , floats - or ipos - are going gangbusters , with snapchat about to sell a slice of the company that would value the whole company at around $ 25bn .
so what 's going on ?
city sources tell me there are a few concerns about new flotations in general .
companies that have previously been owned by private investors ty owe more money to their banks as they were acquired in the first place with borrowed money .
second , their track record of making profits is either shorter or less transparent than established public companies .

third , in the case of biffa , the company is uk focused and relies on the public sector for a chunk of its revenue - an uncertain income stream going into a period where the public finances are likely to be shaken up by the upcoming autumn statement .
add all that to general disquiet about prospects for the uk economy and it 's enough to make investors think twice - or a least want a discount - before buying anything new .
author: Simon Jack
BBC Business Editor

documents.title: moving to frankfurt ?
text: the german banking industry has already started making plans to move some offices and staff from london back to germany , now that brexit is on the cards .
hubertus vaeth , of the marketing body frankfurt main finance , has told reuters that some banks have told him they will be moving some operations to frankfurt in the second half of 2017 .
`` the precise size is still open .
there will be some re-engineering to be done , and there is no pressure to hurry that up , '' vaeth said .
`` we already see small teams , explorative teams looking into certain aspects .
we see options for real estate , and we have very , very clear indications that things will be moved , however , not entire operations , '' vaeth added .

documents.title: ftse close
text: that 's it !
trading has closed on the london stock market for now .
the ftse 100 index ended down by nearly 1 % at 6,948 , with shares in pearson closing more than 8 % lower at 762.5p .
the pound meanwhile is barely changed on the day at $ 1.21860 and against the euro is trading down by 0.23 % at €1.10830 .

documents.title: bank branch closures hit small businesses
text: small businesses are having increasing troubles because of the continued closure of bank branches , says the federation of small business ( fsb ) .
the lobby group says just over 8,000 branches have closed in the past 25 years , with more likely to go .
the fsb points out that many small businesses still use cheques and cash , and need a bank nearby .

documents.title: the ftse 100 explained
text: not sure how the ftse 100 is complied ?
and why it 's so important ?
the team on bbc radio 5 live have asked financial experts to explain .
includes a great fact - there 's only one day that the index has n't been calculated since its launch in 1984 .
and that 's friday 16 october 1984 - the day after the great storm across the uk - when not enough traders could get in to work to open trade .

documents.title: flexible working is n't just for women
text: stories about flexible working requests often focus on women , so it 's nice to feature a man for a change , and a senior one to boot .
since 2005 , julian taylor , a partner at law firm simmons & simmons , has worked from home every wednesday morning and takes the afternoon off to enable him to spend more time with his children .
read more here .
his firm offers similar flexibility to almost all its staff .
it 's something employers ' organisation the cbi believes more firms should be offering , suggesting in a report today that it would broaden the type of people who apply for jobs .
and it believes , and plenty of evidence suggests , that a workforce made up of people from a wider variety of backgrounds , education levels , gender and ethnic backgrounds performs better .
author: Katie Hope
BBC business reporter

documents.title: above the funnelwe 've had some responses to our 'above the funnel ' question :
text: have n't heard the phrase either but as 'the funnel ' is a term for the sales process that starts with general interest an 'filters ' down to actual sales then 'above the funnel ' means creating early stage interest amongst people that are n't aware of the product / service .
they wo n't win an award for plain english that 's for sure !
your `` above the funnel '' piece
would that be referring to 'sales funnel'an american expression meaning 'sales pipeline ' or the english version might be sales forecast ''

documents.title: above the funnel ? splendid nonsense
text: we have received a job advert , via linkedin , for a writer at a well-known business software company .
among the attributes are this : `` author powerful b2b content based on local and global insights that will drive brand preference above the funnel and lead to sales conversion . ''
if you can translate that - especially the bit about the funnel - do drop us a line .
maybe we have led sheltered lives , but it is the first time we have heard that particular bit of business jargon .

documents.title: skiing in switzerland ? douglas fraser , bbc scottish business editor tweets :
text: how many swiss francs to the pound ?
klosters no more : wondering about a swiss ski-ing trip , just like 10 years ago ?
think again .
via @ twitterid
aye , 10 years older for a start douglas .

documents.title: royal liver building for sale
text: the royal liver building is up for sale - for the first time since being built 105 years ago .
once the home of an insurance company , it now houses operations of the bank hsbc and the television firm itv .

documents.title: us market open
text: trading has just got underway in new york - and there 's not a great deal of movement to report to be honest .
the dow jones is very little changed , down 0.1 % at 18,120.95
the s & p 500 has fared similarly - down by 0.13 % to 2130.24
and the nasdaq is down by 0.18 % at 5,205.10

documents.title: hasbro profit
text: profit at the us toymaker hasbro has been lifted by strong demand for its girls toys - including its disney princess and frozen range .
net income rose to $ 257.8m for the third quarter , up from $ 207.6 million .
shares are up more than 5 % in early trading .
chief executive brian goldner said : `` 2016 has been a strong year , including our third quarter - which marked the greatest revenue and earnings quarter in hasbro 's history .
we are well positioned for what we believe will be a good holiday season . ''

documents.title: market update
text: so here 's where we are on european markets - just ahead of the us open .
london 's ftse 100 is down 0.7 % at 6,963.59 , with education firm pearson the biggest faller
germany 's dax is 0.42 % lower at 10,535.43 , led down by consumer and industrial group henkel
france 's cac-40 is 0.3 % down at 4,456.84 , with hotel group accor showing the biggest drop
as far as the pound is concerned - it 's still below $ 1.22 , slipping by 0.17 % against the dollar to $ 1.21670
against the euro it 's down by 0.5 % to €1.10550

documents.title: always learning ?
text: investors have lost more faith in pearson as the morning wears on , with shares in the world 's biggest education company now down more than 8 % .
connor campbell at spreadex says traders appear uninterested in news of a potentially pound-boosted set of full-year results for the former financial times owner .

`` it 's worrying that the company has failed to find a more stable sales base in its education division given that it is now almost solely reliant on that sector after offloading of its major media outlets , '' he says .
author: Chris Johnston
Business reporter

documents.title: breakfast binge
text: first things first your thoughts may now be turning to dinner but here 's a great piece about the rise of our breakfast spend .
in the eight years since 2008 , research group ndp estimates that we have eaten breakfast out an extra 107 million times , while lunch has lost 80 million visits in the same period .
and we shell out more too , spending an average £ 3.30 on breakfast - an increase of 31 % compared with eight years ago .
by contrast , our lunch bills have risen by just 6.5 % in the same period .
read the piece in full here
full disclosure : written by , ahem , yours truly .

documents.title: afternoon all
text: that 's it from ben .
i 'll be taking over for the rest of the afternoon .
author: Emily Young
Business reporter

documents.title: apple parks car project - report
text: fans of apple products will be disappointed to learn that they wo n't be able to drive one .
bloomberg is reporting that apple has drastically scaled back project titan , a scheme to develop an apple car .
hundreds of members of the 1,000-strong team have been laid off , according to the report .
those remaining are going to focus on developing an autonomous driving system , it says .

documents.title: people missing after chemicals plant blast
text: several people are missing and others are injured after an explosion at the giant basf plant in ludwigshafen in germany .
people living near the site have been told to keep doors and windows closed following the blast which happened at around 11.30 this morning .
the cause of the explosion has yet to be determined .

documents.title: good day for good hair day
text: the firm that makes ghd , the leading brand of hair straighteners , is being sold for £ 420m .
the buyer is the us beauty products firm coty which owns , among other things , the clairol , wella and rimmel brands .
if you did n't know ( and i did n't ) ghd stands for good hair day .
the current owner of ghd is a private equiry firm called lion capital , which bought ghd three years ago for £ 300m .
in the past lion capital has bought and sold jimmy choo and wagamama .
it still owns part of weetabix and all of all saints .

documents.title: russia today bank accounts frozen
text: the uk has frozen all bank accounts owned by russia 's state-run broadcaster , russia today ( rt ) , its editor-in-chief has claimed .
margarita simonyan tweeted : `` they 've closed our accounts in britain .
all our accounts .
'the decision is not subject to review . '
praise be to freedom of speech ! ''
rt has previously been sanctioned by ofcom for biased reporting on the conflicts in ukraine and syria .
нам закрыли счета в британии .
все счета .
'решение пересмотру не подлежит ' .
да здравствует свобода слова !
в тысячный раз повторю вопрос , какое отношение к свободе слова имеют руснявые пропагандоны ?

ну хорошо

documents.title: pearson continues to weigh on the ftse 100
text: how has the london stock market done today ?
the ftse 100 share index was down 46 points a few moments ago , at 6,968 .
that is not much of a move though ; a drop of just 0.7 % this morning .
the big loser today has been the educational publisher pearson after its down beat trading statement .
it shares are down 10.5 % at 746p .
mining firms have been the biggest gainers so far , with glencore up 1.8 % and anglo-american up 1.3 % .

documents.title: 'full confidence '
text: theresa may has `` full confidence '' in chancellor philip hammond , downing street has said - amid reports some cabinet colleagues are becoming frustrated as his support for a `` soft brexit '' .
mr hammond was said to have angered pro-brexit ministers after he called for a delay on migration controls over concerns of the impact on business , according to newspaper reports .
however , theresa may 's official spokeswoman said : `` the prime minister has full confidence in the chancellor and the work that he is doing . ''
we do wonder if mrs may is aware of what often happens when a football club expresses its `` full confidence '' in a manager

documents.title: energy firm sells £ 621m stake
text: sse is selling a stake in its gas distribution business to a gulf state sovereign wealth fund for £ 621m .
scotia gas networks ( sgn ) distributes gas to almost six million properties in scotland and the south of england .
the scottish energy firm agreed to sell 16.7 % of sgn to subsidiaries of the abu dhabi investment authority .
it follows a slump in profit at sse and a heavy writedown of its power generation and natural gas assets .

documents.title: the pound 's progress
text: how has sterling done today ?
against the euro it is currently down 0.3 % at 1.107 euros .
and against the us dollar it is 0.2 % lower at $ 1.216 .

documents.title: bank of america profits rise
text: bank of america has reported third quarter results .
it reported a net income of $ 5bn , up 7 % on the same quarter in 2015 .
sales increased 3 % to $ 21.6bn .
its global markets business saw profits rise to more than $ 1bn .

documents.title: brexit : 'sort it out '
text: britain needs to sort out its relationship with the european union before it can begin to talk to the united states about any post-brexit trade deal .
a statement of the obvious ?
maybe , but the us trade representative michael froman has said it .

he told reuters in geneva : `` the practicality is that until the uk sorts through with the eu the nature of its relationship it 's impossible to have a serious conversation about knowing what kind of trade agreement you can have with the uk separately . ''

documents.title: uk bond yields rise
text: interested in the slightly arcane world of bond investment ?
the yield on 10-year , uk government bonds has risen this morning to 1.18 % , which , says reuters , is the highest level since the brexit vote at the end of june .
the chart above shows the 10-year gild yield for the year so far .
how come ?

the prospect of higher uk inflation , at least in the short term , means the price of these 10-year gilts ( as the government ious are called ) - which pay a fixed rate of interest - has fallen back a bit , thus driving up the yield available to any new investors .

documents.title: heathrow plan faces cabinet scrutiny
text: `` theresa may is to allow a short pause on whether to give the go-ahead to a new runway at heathrow so that cabinet ministers can express their views . ''
that 's the latest development from our economics editor , kamal ahmed .

documents.title: pearson 's currency gain
text: despite the gloomy tone of the publisher 's trading update , the group will benefit from the recent fall in the value of the pound .
that is because it makes much of its money abroad , especially in the us .
`` if current exchange rates persist until the end of 2016 , the earnings per share guidance range will increase by approximately 4.5p , '' the firm says .
so it 's not all bad news for shareholders .

documents.title: clegg warns on food price hike
text: food prices will shoot up if the uk leaves the eu single market , former deputy prime minister nick clegg is warning .
in a report out today he says exports and imports with the eu will come with hefty tariffs if the uk relies on world trade organisation rules when it leaves the bloc .
that includes 59 % on beef , 38 % on chocolate , 40 % on cheese and 14 % on wine , he says , using a wto mapping tool .
`` a hard brexit will lead us off a cliff edge towards higher food prices , with a triple whammy of punishing tariffs , customs checks and workforce shortages , '' mr clegg says .
he adds that last week 's marmite dispute was the `` tip of the iceberg '' .
business reporter theo leggett is appalled at the thought :
`` it 's clear that # marmite was just the tip of the iceberg '' - nick clegg .
marmite-tipped icebergs now that would be the end of civilisation

documents.title: japan 's nikkei closes higher as yen weakens
text: japan 's stock market ended monday higher , as the yen weakened against the us dollar .
the dollar rose above 104 yen on friday , and a weaker yen is seen as beneficial to japan 's exporting companies .
japan 's benchmark nikkei share index closed up 0.3 % at 16,900.12 .
in china the market was lower as investors wait for the latest set of chinese gdp figures , due on wednesday .
the shanghai composite closed down 0.7 % at 3,041.17 , while in hong kong the hang seng index ended 0.8 % lower at 23,037.54 .

documents.title: boe says pound fall 'important shock absorber '
text: more from radio 5 live 's interview with ben broadbent , deputy governor of the bank of england .
`` having a flexible currency is an extremely important thing , especially in an environment where your economy faces shocks that are different to your trading partners .
in the shape of the referendum we have had exactly one of those shocks and allowing the currency to react to that is a very important shock absorber . ''
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: the 'huge challenge ' facing pearson
text: look away now pearson investors .
shares have tumbled 8 % after the company 's latest trading update .
george salmon , equity analyst at hargreaves lansdown writes :

having sold off the economist and the financial times , pearson is now relying on its core educational businesses for forward momentum , but convincing customers to continue paying for its content represents a huge challenge to the group against a backdrop of free educational resources popping up online .
despite enjoying the benefits of a weaker pound , sales have been falling recently and there was little in today 's update to suggest that the tide is changing . ''

documents.title: adman explains remain campaign flop
text: m & c saatchi helped the remain campaign in the run-up to the referendum vote .
moray maclennan is the worldwide chief executive of the famous advertising firm , he explained why the focus on the potential economic impact of brexit did not work .

documents.title: bank of england 'accommodating ' to excess inflation
text: the prospect of rising inflation does not appear to be unsettling the top players at the bank of england .

bank of england deputy governor ben broadbent told the bbc that the bank is prepared to accommodate `` a little excess inflation relative to the target , in order to reduce the risk of rise in unemployment '' .
he also said that the pound 's fall had acted as an important shock absorber for the economy .
last week boe governor mark carney said he was willing to see an `` overshoot '' of its 2 % inflation target if it meant supporting economic growth and protecting jobs .

documents.title: pearson leads ftse 100 lower
text: the ftse 100 has kicked off with a loss of 0.45 % , trading at 6,982 .
educational publisher , pearson has fallen 2.7 % after its quarterly update .
the company 's chief executive said the `` market conditions continue to be challenging '' .
ladbrokes shares are down 1.7 % .

documents.title: uk to pay for city access to single market ?
text: according to the financial times , under a plan being considered by the cabinet , the city of london might be able to keep its cherished access to the european single market , if the government pays billions of pounds to the european union .
at the moment financial firms based in the uk have a business passport to sell their products across europe , but that could be lost after brexit .
according to the article , prime minister theresa may has not ruled out paying to keep that system in place .

documents.title: euro architect gloomy about currency 's future
text: one of the central figures in the creation of the euro has warned over the outlook for the single currency project , the telegraph reports .
`` one day the house of cards will collapse , '' says professor otmar issing , the first chief economist of the european central bank .

`` realistically , it will be a case of muddling through , struggling from one crisis to the next , '' he told the journal , central banking , and reported by the telegraph 's ambrose evans-pritchard .
professor issing 's main complaint is that there is no way of enforcing fiscal discipline among members of the euro .

documents.title: ladbrokes-coral to sell 359 shops
text: bookmakers ladbrokes and gala coral have agreed to sell 359 shops to rival betting firms in what they say is the `` last significant hurdle '' for their £ 2.3bn merger .
betfred will buy 322 shops and stan james the other 37 for a total of £ 55.5m .
competition regulators ruled in july that ladbrokes and coral must sell 350-400 shops for their merger to be approved .
ladbrokes and coral will ask the competition and markets authority to approve the merger once the 359 sites , plus one remaining shop , are sold .

documents.title: biffa in 'cut price ' share sale
text: it seems that biffa has been forced to cut the price of its shares to assure its stock market debut .
the waste firm has announced that shares will be priced at 180p each .
the financial times reported that it had failed to generate enough interest at a previous price range of 220-270p .
at least its shares sale is going ahead , others have failed to make it over the start line .
pure gym and ti fluid systems both abandoned their share sales recently , blaming unfavourable market conditions .

documents.title: pound back below $ 1.22
text: sterling is back below $ 1.22 and €1.11 after falling 0.3 % in asian trading .
it has been hovering around that level in recent days , and is currently trading at $ 1.216 and €1.107 .
the pound is down more than 5 % so far this month against the dollar and is weaker against every other g10 currency , said kathleen brooks , research director at city index .
`` to put this month 's fall into context , the pound is weaker against the majority of emerging market currencies , including the resurgent mexican peso and the malaysian ringgit , '' she said .
she suggested the latest fall was due to reports - denied by the treasury - that chancellor philip hammond could quit and risks of a second scottish referendum .

documents.title: why have casino workers in china been arrested ?
text: `` it 's thought the staff - including three australians - are accused of soliciting chinese high rollers to gamble in australian casinos - something that carries a maximum 10-year jail term .
the head of crown 's vip international team is among those being held .
in its last results crown said it was putting extra resources into getting rich foreigners to come and bet in its australian casinos after business in macau slowed down . ''
author: Simon Atkinson
Asia business reporter

documents.title: arrests at australian casino firm in china
text: australian casino company crown resorts confirmed that 18 of its staff have been detained by authorities in china .
the company - which is controlled by australian billionaire james packer - said 15 local staff as well as three australian citizens including a senior executive , are being questioned .
it is not clear why they have been detained .
the bbc 's shanghai correspondent , robin brant said :
`` the husband of one of the local chinese crown employees arrested has told the bbc he is 'completely dumbfounded ' about why she has been detained .
he said his wife was questioned for almost three hours after police arrived at their shanghai apartment in the early hours of friday morning .
she was taken away and he was formally advised of her arrest yesterday . ''

documents.title: uk engineering warns over brexit impact
text: engineering could be hobbled if brexit means an end to free movement of labour , according to a report published today by the royal academy of engineering , which represents nearly half a million industry professionals .
it says that the uk relies heavily on overseas engineering expertise .
hayaatun sillem , deputy chief executive of the royal academy of engineering is on the today programme :
`` what 's going to be incredibly important is that the government projects a really positive message at this time of uncertainty , '' she says .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: japanese shares rises on weaker yen
text: japanese shares have started the week on a positive note with the nikkei 225 up by 0.4 % on a weaker yen boosting the country 's export sector .
companies including toyota , honda and panasonic have seen their shares move higher in early trading .
in china , the mainland shanghai composite is flat while the hang seng in hong kong is down by 0.6 % .
in australia , the asx 200 is lower by 0.7 % while south korea 's kospi has gained 0.5 %

documents.title: uk economy : 'growth to fall , inflation to rise '
text: britain 's economy faces a of weaker growth as consumer spending slows and business curbs investment , according to a report .
although the ey item club think tank predicts the economy will grow 1.9 % this year , it expects that performance to dissipate as inflation rises .
the bank of england has said that it will allow inflation to run-ahead of its target of 2 % , to preserve economic growth
richard dunbar , investment director at aberdeen asset management , makes the point that the bank of england `` has been here before '' .
the bank `` correctly '' ignored the impact of rising oil prices , and now it is likely to look beyond the effects of the weak pound , he says .
author: BBC Radio 4

documents.title: european market outlook
text: david buik from panmure gordon tweets :
european opening reflects a degree of uncertainty over us elections & dollar strength - ftse -4 , dax -25 , cac -10 ( futures ) courtesy of ig
bonds sell off shows stocks will not be far behind david as we still see dow down 1,250 points election jitters higher rates

documents.title: tesla new product launch delayed
text: the announcement of a mysterious new product from tesla has been delayed until wednesday .
founder and chief executive , elon musk tweets :
moving the tesla announcement to wednesday .
needs a few more days of refinement .
tesla / rosie
tesla / rosie
it is wednesday here for 40more minutes what the news we were waiting for : ) ?
the announcement is batteries is n't it ! !
too soon for on-demand self-driving tesla 's ? # byebyeuber
well .
it 's a step in that direction ; ) next announcement : tesla taxi app to take me to my destination .
tesla / say
tesla / feather
when does it start and it will be streaming at right ?
# lovetesla # innovation
what 's the announcement about ?
auto pilot？
what time is the tesla announcement ?
looking forward to it .
any update on the timeline ?
is this still happening today ?
dying of curiosity .
right that would be a waste of `` news '' with the stock having a bearish technical chart wait for low of $ 188-193 then pump it up lol

documents.title: uk ship building industry
text: the building of the rrs david attenborough in birkenhead is a big deal for the uk shipping industry .
there will be a keel laying ceremony on monday for the £ 200m vessel .
steph kenyon , from the uk chamber of shipping says the uk is well equippted to build advanced vessels like this , as well as specialist leisure boats and fast ferries .
but we should not expect the uk to be building the big tankers and container ships , she says on wake up to money .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: business wish list from autumn statement
text: no new business taxes , reform business rates and invest in infrastructure .
that 's the wish list from the british chambers of commerce , before the chancellor 's autumn statement next month .
wake up to money speaks to executives from small businesses .
the see the weak pound as an opportunity .
dianne duffey from heap & partners thinks the government should spend more on helping small business export .
her company supplies the oil and gas market .
she says we need a `` period of relative stability '' and some certainty over brexit .
author: BBC Radio 5 live

documents.title: good morning !
text: welcome to monday 's business live page .
business is trying to get its message across to the chancellor ahead of his autumn statement next month .
a respected think tank warns about a slowdown in the uk economy in the coming years .
and tesla delays a mysterious new product .
author: Ben Morris
Business reporter
